title: Jerry Gillespie
text:
Jerry Wayne Gillespie (born <a href="Decatur%2C%20Alabama">Decatur</a>, <a href="Alabama">Alabama</a>) is an American country songwriter. He co-wrote "<a href="Do%20You%20Love%20as%20Good%20as%20You%20Look">Do You Love as Good as You Look</a>", a #1 song in 1981 for <a href="The%20Bellamy%20Brothers">The Bellamy Brothers</a> and wrote "<a href="Heaven%27s%20Just%20a%20Sin%20Away">Heaven's Just a Sin Away</a>", a #1 country hit in 1977 for <a href="The%20Kendalls">The Kendalls</a>. He co-wrote "<a href="Somebody%27s%20Knockin%27">Somebody's Knockin'</a>", a <a href="Grammy%20Award">Grammy Award</a> finalist in 1982 for <a href="Terri%20Gibbs">Terri Gibbs</a>, and "<a href="I%20Just%20Can%27t%20Stay%20Married%20to%20You">I Just Can't Stay Married to You</a>", a #5 hit for <a href="Christy%20Lane">Christy Lane</a> in 1979.
He wrote or co-wrote a number of successful songs for <a href="Tommy%20Overstreet">Tommy Overstreet</a>, including "Gwen (Congratulations)", co-written with Ricci Mareno, a #5 country hit in 1971, and "That's When My Woman Begins a #6 country hit in 1975. Gillespie also worked as a producer with Christy Lane, The Kendalls, and Micki Fuhrman.
Gillespie's first music venture was with his cousin Gary in a <a href="Nashville">Nashville</a>-area teenaged rock band named "The Valiants". The band put out two singles in 1965-1966 with songs written by Gillespie.
Other Gillespie songs that charted.
"Heaven's Just a Sin Away" also charted in a minor way for <a href="Kelly%20Willis">Kelly Willis</a> in 1993 (#63 Country). "Old Pictures" and "Dr. Dr." were written by Gillespie with <a href="K.%20T.%20Oslin">K. T. Oslin</a>, and appeared on her platinum-selling 1987 debut album "<a href="80s%20Ladies">80s Ladies</a>". His Christmas song "Blue Decorations" was covered by <a href="B.%20B.%20King">B. B. King</a> on his 2001 Grammy-winning album "<a href="A%20Christmas%20Celebration%20of%20Hope">A Christmas Celebration of Hope</a>".
